citations.narrative:
Ventilation. There was a consistent ammonia odor in the guinea pig room at time of this inspection. Windows were
partially opened along the bottom, but the opened windows did not remove the ammonia odor. Ammonia odors can
increase respiratory illnesses in animals. Indoor housing facilities for guinea pigs shall be adequately ventilated to protect
the health of the animals. Increasing the cleaning frequency during the winter months to removed wet and soiled bedding
and adding an exhaust fan to removed ammonia odors from the animal room can aide in reducing ammonia levels.
Licensee must ensure that adequate ventilation is provided to the animals to protect their health and comfort. Correct by
February 15, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.26(b) 
   
Facilities, indoor. 
Ventilation. There was a consistent ammonia odor in the guinea pig room at time of this inspection. Windows were 
partially opened along the bottom, but the opened windows did not remove the ammonia odor. Ammonia odors can 
increase respiratory illnesses in animals. Indoor housing facilities for guinea pigs shall be adequately ventilated to protect 
the health of the animals. Increasing the cleaning frequency during the winter months to removed wet and soiled bedding 
and adding an exhaust fan to removed ammonia odors from the animal room can aide in reducing ammonia levels. 
Licensee must ensure that adequate ventilation is provided to the animals to protect their health and comfort. Correct by 
February 15, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
